intro: Aureolaria, commonly known as sweetroot or goldenroot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellow or white flowers. The leaves are typically trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant is native to North America and is often found in moist, open habitats. Aureolaria species are known for their medicinal properties and have been used traditionally for their purported health benefits.
